main_info.paragraph: Day 147: Read more research papers
Day 146: Watched some pros and reviewed my own games.
Day 145: Played some Lol :)
Day 144: A relaxing friday
Day 143: Wrote a python automation script at work!
Read DDPG Paper. This one was a tricky beast. Need to look at some more articles!
Day 142: It doesn't work because ____
Read H-DQN paper.

The reason why my Dropping Fruit game did not work is because I didn't use a convolutional layer to find relations between the different numerical values. By using a convolutional layer with filters, it would allow the AI to understand the relation/pattern of the game. >:( Bad Ding!
Continued with the video tutorial as a good refresher of some past concepts.
Day 141: Boring day at work >:( new job hunt?
Read A3C research paper.
Started watching a video tutorial on Deep Reinforcement Learning. (Skowster the Geek)
Day 140: Reading more learning algorithms
Read Advanced DQNs: Playing Pac-man with Deep Reinforcement Learning by Jake Grigsby (06/29/2018)
Looked over REINFORCE research paper.
Day 139: Resetting League Controls

I reverted some of my league controls. I was having issue with the left click auto-attack move option. It allowed me to react faster, but I couldn't really use the mini-map. This is a huge hinderence due to the fact that I need information from the map...
Going to take a few days to get back to the old ways.
Day 138: Played Haven and Hearth
Relaxed on a farm in the middle of the ocean.
Day 137: So it is learning something...

The Dropping fruit game was learning something. However, it seems that it is pretty similar to a stubborn teenager where once it believes that it is the right path it is very hard to him/her to change his mind.
I will be putting this project on hold now. Going to start looking into more deep learning algorithms.
Day 136: Wait a second... not really a false alarm?
Read a couple of research papers on p-christ github regarding DQN.
Created ZigZag map and running it to see if machine can learn optimal path.
Day 135: False alarm what a let down!
Added a reward print statement to see results. Realized yesterday it wasnt really converging. Got baited. Probably a backpropagation update issue or maybe the input data just isn't that good?
Running the simulation on a clear patterned map with a correct solution. Results are looking good.
After around 50k iteration the neural network can learn from a patterned map that I created. The map has a clear solution for optimal policy which the DQN AI is able to find! :)
Read the Double DQN Research Paper
Day 134: Get back on the road. Let's go
Ran 3.87 miles in 43:09 minutes
Reread the DQN Atari game article
Made adjustments to the dropping fruit game. It is converging holy shit....
Day 133: The pace of learning is too slow.
Day 132: Played a bunch of ranked games. Tilted a bit.
